lead_paragraph: ROWLEY--Adelaide "Mouse" Storer. Passed away peacefully on March 31 at her home in Chestnut Hill, MA. She was 96. She always put her family first and was devoted to charitable work. Born in New York City in 1920, she was the daughter of Francis E. Storer, Sr. and Eleanor Hastings. Educated at Miss Hewitt's Classes in Manhattan, she did volunteer work for the Junior League, Red Cross and other charities during WWII and later was a secretary in the health field. Mrs. Rowley lived in Chicago from 1950 to 1958 and then in the Boston area, where she did volunteer work for numerous charities. Beloved wife of Edward D. Rowley, who preceded her in death, and devoted mother of Maeve Magee; Edward D. Rowley, Jr. (Tina Pope), and Storer H. Rowley (Carolyn Lesh); grandmother of Renana and Dylan Magee, Mary and Elizabeth Rowley and Catharine Rowley, and great-grandmother of three. A memorial service will be held Friday at 1pm at the Church of the Redeemer, Chestnut Hill, MA. In lieu of flowers, please send donations to the MSPCA-Angell, 350 South Huntington Ave., Boston, MA 02130. 1/3
